snippet: A clamor for Britain to exit the European Union appeared to be spreading even as Prime Minister David Cameron met with President Obama in Washington.
abstract: Pres Obama, after state visit from British Prime Min David Cameron, urges Britons to not give up on their membership in the European Union without first seeking to improve it; statement highlights Obama's attempt to calm clamor within Britain's Conservative Party and reflects America's growing worries that one of its closest allies is moving toward leaving the 27-nation bloc.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: A clamor for Britain to exit the European Union appeared to be spreading even as Prime Minister David Cameron met with President Obama in Washington.

headline.seo: Britain’s Conservatives Split Over European Union
headline.main: As British Prime Minister Visits Washington, His Party Splits Over European Union
headline.print_headline: As British Prime Minister Visits Washington, His Party Splits Over European Union
